documentation.text:
@title This is a common interface for apps to interact with disputes’ standard operations.
  Sets a standard arbitrable contract implementation to provide a general purpose user interface.

attributes.text:
@title This is a common interface for apps to interact with disputes’ standard operations.
  Sets a standard arbitrable contract implementation to provide a general purpose user interface.

Contribution(uint256,uint256,uint256,add.details: Raised when a contribution is made, inside fundAppeal function.

params.localDisputeID: The dispute id as in the arbitrable contract.
params.round: The round number the contribution was made to.
params.ruling: Indicates the ruling option which got the contribution.

RulingFunded(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: To be raised when a ruling option is fully funded for appeal.

params.localDisputeID: The dispute id as in arbitrable contract.
params.round: Round code of the appeal. Starts from 0.
params.ruling: THe ruling option which just got fully funded.

Withdrawal(uint256,uint256,uint256,addre.details: Raised when a contributor withdraws non-zero value.

params.localDisputeID: The dispute id as in arbitrable contract.
params.reward: Total amount of deposits reimbursed plus rewards. This amount will be sent to contributor as an effect of calling withdrawFeesAndRewards function.
params.round: The round number the withdrawal was made from.
params.ruling: Indicates the ruling option which contributor gets rewards from.

externalIDtoLocalID(uint256).details: Maps external (arbitrator side) dispute id to local (arbitrable) dispute id. This is necessary to obtain local dispute data by arbitrators id.

params._externalDisputeID: Dispute id as in arbitrator side.

returns.localDisputeID: Dispute id as in arbitrable contract.

fundAppeal(uint256,uint256).details: TRUSTED. Manages contributions and calls appeal function of the specified arbitrator to appeal a dispute. This function lets appeals be crowdfunded. Note that we don’t need to check that msg.value is enough to pay arbitration fees as it’s the responsibility of the arbitrator contract.

params._localDisputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.
params._ruling: The ruling option to which the caller wants to contribute.

returns.fullyFunded: True if the ruling option got fully funded as a result of this contribution.

returns.loserAppealPeriodMultiplier: Losers appeal period multiplier. The loser is given less time to fund its appeal to defend against last minute appeal funding attacks.

getTotalWithdrawableAmount(uint256,addre.details: Returns the sum of withdrawable amount.

params._contributedTo: Ruling options to look for potential withdrawals.
params._contributor: The contributor for which to query.
params._localDisputeID: The ID of the associated question.

returns.sum: The total amount available to withdraw.

numberOfRulingOptions(uint256).details: Returns number of possible ruling options. Valid rulings are [0, return value].

params._localDisputeID: Dispute id as in arbitrable contract.

rule(uint256,uint256).details: Give a ruling for a dispute. Must be called by the arbitrator. The purpose of this function is to ensure that the address calling it has the right to rule on the contract.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute in the Arbitrator contract.
params._ruling: Ruling given by the arbitrator. Note that 0 is reserved for "Not able/wanting to make a decision".

submitEvidence(uint256,string).details: Allows to submit evidence for a given dispute.

params._localDisputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.

withdrawFeesAndRewards(uint256,address,u.details: Allows to withdraw any reimbursable fees or rewards after the dispute gets solved.

params._contributor: The address to withdraw its rewards.
params._localDisputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.
params._roundNumber: The number of the round caller wants to withdraw from.
params._ruling: A ruling option that the caller wants to withdraw fees and rewards related to it.

returns.sum: The reward that is going to be paid as a result of this function call, if it's not zero.

withdrawFeesAndRewardsForAllRounds(uint2.details: Allows to withdraw any rewards or reimbursable fees after the dispute gets resolved. For multiple rulings options and for all rounds at once.

params._contributedTo: Rulings that received contributions from contributor.
params._contributor: The address to withdraw its rewards.
params._localDisputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.

withdrawFeesAndRewardsForMultipleRulings.details: Allows to withdraw any reimbursable fees or rewards after the dispute gets solved. For multiple ruling options at once.

params._contributedTo: Rulings that received contributions from contributor.
params._contributor: The address to withdraw its rewards.
params._localDisputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.
params._roundNumber: The number of the round caller wants to withdraw from.

devdoc.title: This is a common interface for apps to interact with disputes’ standard operations.  Sets a standard arbitrable contract implementation to provide a general purpose user interface.
